intro: Swartzia myrtifolia, commonly known as the myrtle-leaved swartzia, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its wood is valued for its durability and is used in furniture and construction. Swartzia myrtifolia plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
